current_focus.notes: Layer 4 Pass 1 COMPLETE! All 11 libraries annotated: HiGHS, Gravity, cuopt, SHOT, Cmpl, OS, Creme, GAMSlinks, Sonnet. clp-spreadsheet-solver skipped (minimal headers).

CoinUtils.notes: Pass 2 COMPLETE! 34 core algorithm files annotated with @algorithm/@math/@complexity/@ref tags
pass2_algorithms_documented: LU factorization with Markowitz pivot selection
Warm start basis encoding (2-bit status per variable)
Duplicate column/row detection via random hashing

SuiteSparse.notes: Pass 2 COMPLETE! All 9 major headers now have @algorithm/@math/@complexity/@ref tags
key_algorithms_documented: AMD - approximate minimum degree ordering (O(nnz·α(n)) with aggressive absorption)
COLAMD - column AMD for unsymmetric LU (quotient graph representation)
BTF - Tarjan's SCC + maximum transversal (O(nnz + n))
CSparse - teaching implementation with CSC/COO formats
LDL - up-looking LDL' for symmetric indefinite (elimination tree)
KLU - left-looking LU with BTF preprocessing (O(n log n) for circuit matrices)
CHOLMOD - supernodal/simplicial Cholesky with GPU (O(nnz(L)²/m))
UMFPACK - multifrontal LU with threshold pivoting (elimination tree + BLAS-3)
pass2_math_documented: AMD: approximate degree d̃(i) via quotient graph
BTF: P·A·Q block upper triangular with SCCs
LDL: A = L·D·L' with elimination tree parent[j] = min{i > j : L(i,j) ≠ 0}
CHOLMOD: L(j,j) = √(A(j,j) - Σ L(j,k)²), update/downdate via Givens
UMFPACK: P·R·A·Q = L·U with threshold pivoting |a_kk| ≥ τ·max|a_ik|
KLU: BTF blocks factored independently with left-looking column-by-column LU

Clp.notes: Pass 1 complete! All 87 header files annotated with @file/@brief/@see tags
key_subsystems_documented: Core: ClpModel → ClpSimplex → ClpSimplexDual/Primal architecture
ABC: FasterCoin SIMD-optimized simplex (AbcSimplex, CoinAbcFactorization)
Interior Point: ClpInterior with Cholesky backends (Pardiso, CHOLMOD, MUMPS, etc.)
Positive Edge: Anti-degeneracy via compatible variable identification
PDCO: Alternative interior point using iterative LSQR solver
Network: ClpNetworkMatrix/ClpNetworkBasis for pure network problems
Nonlinear: ClpSimplexNonlinear with SLP for QP/NLP
Dynamic: ClpDynamicMatrix/ClpGubDynamicMatrix for column generation
C Interface: Clp_C_Interface.h for C language bindings

key_algorithms_documented: Online Active Set Strategy for parametric QP

Couenne.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! All 103 header files annotated with @file/@brief/@see tags. Global optimizer for nonconvex MINLP using spatial B&B with convexification.
key_subsystems_documented: Core: CouenneProblem (symbolic MINLP representation with expression DAG)
Expression DAG: expression base, exprVar, exprAux (w=f(x)), exprOp (n-ary operators), exprConst, exprCopy, exprClone, exprStore, exprIVar

Expression Operators: Mul (McCormick), Quad (alpha-convexification), Pow, Log, Exp, Sin, Cos, Div, Sum, Abs, Group, Trilinear, Min, Max, Inv, Floor, Ceil, Opp, Sub, SignPow, OddPow, EvenPow, MultiLin, BinProd, If, Norm, PWLinear
Bound Operators: exprLB/UBCos, exprLB/UBSin, exprLB/UBDiv, exprLB/UBMul, exprLB/UBQuad (interval arithmetic for FBBT)
Cut Generation: CouenneCutGenerator (convexification), CouenneDisjCuts (CGLP), CouenneSdpCuts (PSD), CouenneCrossConv (auxiliary relationships), CouenneEllipCuts (placeholder)
Bound Tightening: CouenneFixPoint (FBBT), CouenneAggrProbing (OBBT), CouenneMultiVarProbe, CouenneBTPerfIndicator, CouenneTwoImplied, CouenneSparseBndVec (Briggs-Torczon), CouenneInfeasCut

Branching: CouenneObject, CouenneBranchingObject, CouenneVarObject, CouenneThreeWayBranchObj, CouenneChooseVariable/Strong, CouenneComplObject/ComplBranchingObject (complementarity), CouenneSOSObject, CouenneVTObject (violation transfer), CouenneProjections
Symmetry: CouenneNauty, CouenneOrbitObj, CouenneOrbitBranchingObj (orbital branching)
Heuristics: CouenneFeasPump, CouenneFPpool, CouenneIterativeRounding, BonInitHeuristic, BonNlpHeuristic

Interfaces: CouenneTNLP (Ipopt), CouenneBab (B&B driver), CouenneUserInterface (abstract), CouenneMINLPInterface (OSI wrapper), CouenneAmplInterface (AMPL .nl), CouenneOSInterface (Optimization Services)
Setup: BonCouenneSetup, BonCouenneInterface (Bonmin/AMPL integration), BonCouenneInfo
Problem: CouenneDepGraph (variable dependencies), CouenneGlobalCutOff (incumbent), CouenneProblemElem (Constraint/Objective), CouenneRecordBestSol, CouenneSolverInterface
SDP: CouennePSDcon (X⪰0 constraints), CouenneMatrix (sparse expressions), dsyevx_wrapper (LAPACK eigenvalues)

Utilities: CouenneSparseMatrix (COO storage), CouenneRootQ (Q^k polynomial roots), CouennePrecisions (tolerances), CouenneLQelems (standardization), CouenneFunTriplets (derivatives), CouenneDomain (bound stack), CouenneJournalist (logging), CouExpr (algebraic API)
Partial Derivatives: CouenneExprJac (symbolic Jacobian), CouenneExprHess (symbolic Hessian of Lagrangian)
key_algorithms_documented: Spatial branch-and-bound for global MINLP optimization
Expression DAG representation with auxiliary variables
FBBT - Feasibility-based bound tightening via fixpoint iteration
OBBT - Optimality-based bound tightening via LP/NLP probing
Two-implied bound tightening from constraint pairs
McCormick envelopes for bilinear terms (4 linear cuts)
Alpha-convexification for quadratics (eigenvalue-based)
Convexification cuts: tangent (convex), secant (concave), envelopes
Trigonometric functions: period-aware convexification (sin, cos)
Disjunctive cuts via CGLP (Cut-Generating LP)
SDP cuts exploiting positive semidefiniteness of product matrices
Strong branching with LP re-solve
Three-way spatial branching
Violation transfer branching (aggregate auxiliary violations)
Symmetry detection via nauty for orbital branching
Complementarity branching for MPEC constraints (x₁·x₂=0)
Feasibility pump for MINLP with alternating MILP/NLP phases
Iterative rounding heuristic (F-IR and I-IR)
NLP heuristic for near-integer solutions
Dependency graph for evaluation ordering
Interval arithmetic for bound propagation (safeProd, safeDiv)
Q^k polynomial roots for odd power convexification (Liberti-Pantelides)
SOS Type 1/2 branching with FBBT integration
Symbolic Jacobian/Hessian via expression DAG differentiation
Briggs-Torczon sparse vector (O(1) initialization)
Function triplets for convexification (f, f', f'', (f')⁻¹)
Domain push/pop for B&B backtracking

SYMPHONY.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 39 headers annotated with @file/@brief/@see tags. Parallel branch-cut-price framework for MILP.

Tree Manager: sym_tm.h (B&C tree, node selection, two-phase algorithm)
LP Process: sym_lp.h (LP relaxation, cuts, branching, pseudo-costs)

PVM Communication: sym_proccomm.h, sym_messages.h (parallel mode)
Support: sym_constants.h, sym_macros.h, sym_types.h, sym_proto.h
key_algorithms_documented: Parallel branch-and-cut with Master-Worker architecture
Node selection rules: best-bound, depth-first, best-first
Two-phase algorithm (Phase 1: few cuts, Phase 2: more cuts)
Strong branching and reliability branching
CGL cut integration (Gomory, MIR, probing, clique, etc.)
User callbacks for custom cuts, branching, feasibility
Preprocessing: bound tightening, probing, single-row relaxation
Feasibility pump, rounding, diving heuristics
Local branching, RINS (Relaxation Induced Neighborhood Search)

PVM-based distributed computing

Bcp.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 27 headers annotated. IBM's Branch-Cut-Price framework for parallel MILP with column generation.
key_subsystems_documented: Core: BCP_enum (LP status, branching), BCP_USER (entry points), bcp_main()
Processes: BCP_tm (Tree Manager), BCP_lp (LP), BCP_cg (Cut Gen), BCP_vg (Var Gen)
Objects: BCP_var (core/algo), BCP_cut (core/algo), BCP_solution
User Hooks: BCP_tm_user, BCP_lp_user, BCP_cg_user, BCP_vg_user (virtual callbacks)
Branching: BCP_branch, BCP_lp_branch (strong branching objects)
Delta Encoding: BCP_obj_change, BCP_node_change, BCP_problem_core_change
Parameters: BCP_tm_param, BCP_lp_param (configuration enums)
Serialization: BCP_buffer (message passing), BCP_user_pack (custom serialization)
Data Structures: BCP_vector (custom vector), BCP_matrix (LP relaxation)
key_algorithms_documented: Branch-Cut-Price: simultaneous column and cut generation
Multi-process architecture: TM, LP, CG, VG processes
Column generation: pricing subproblem for negative reduced cost columns
Cut generation: violated cuts from LP solutions
Delta encoding: parent-relative changes for tree storage
Storage modes: Explicit, WrtCore, WrtParent
Strong branching: presolved LP results for branch candidates
Effectiveness tracking: cuts track tight/slack iterations

CHiPPS-ALPS.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 21 headers annotated. Abstract Library for Parallel Search - framework for parallel tree-based branch-and-bound.
key_subsystems_documented: Core Framework: Alps.h (enums, constants), AlpsKnowledge (serializable base)
Tree Search: AlpsModel (problem abstraction), AlpsTreeNode (node lifecycle)
Knowledge Broker: AlpsKnowledgeBroker (serial/MPI manager), AlpsSubTree (work units)
Pools: AlpsNodePool, AlpsSolutionPool, AlpsSubTreePool (priority queues)
Strategies: AlpsSearchStrategy template (BestFirst, DepthFirst, BreadthFirst)
Serialization: AlpsEncoded (MPI message buffer), AlpsNodeDesc (subproblem data)
Parameters: AlpsParameterBase, AlpsParams (configuration management)
Parallel: Master-Hub-Worker architecture, load balancing, rampup/rampdown phases
key_algorithms_documented: Master-Hub-Worker parallel tree search architecture
Knowledge Broker pattern for coordination
Subtree as basic unit of parallel work
Search phases: Rampup (initialization), Search, Rampdown (termination)
Inter-cluster load balancing (master↔hubs)
Intra-cluster load balancing (hub↔workers)
Node lifecycle: Candidate→Evaluated→Pregnant→Branched→Fathomed
AlpsEncoded serialization with writeRep/readRep templates

CHiPPS-BLIS.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 22 headers annotated. BiCePS Linear Integer Solver - MILP branch-and-cut built on ALPS/BiCePS framework.
key_subsystems_documented: Core: Blis.h (enums: LP status, return status, strategies), BlisModel.h (MILP model with LP solver, generators, heuristics), BlisTreeNode.h (node processing: LP solve, cuts, branching)
Branching Strategies: MaxInfeasibility (most fractional), PseudoCost (learned estimates), Reliability (hybrid), Strong (solve child LPs), Bilevel (bilevel programming)
Branching Objects: BlisBranchObjectInt (integer dichotomy), BlisBranchObjectBilevel (multi-variable), BlisObjectInt (variable with pseudo-costs)
Node/Variable: BlisNodeDesc (LP basis, branching history), BlisVariable (column generation), BlisPseudo (pseudo-cost data)
Constraints: BlisConstraint (sparse row cuts), BlisConGenerator (CGL wrapper with strategy control)
Heuristics: BlisHeuristic (primal heuristic base), BlisHeurRound (simple rounding with matrix storage)
Support: BlisParams (parameter set), BlisMessage (CoinMessageHandler logging), BlisSolution (integer solution), BlisHelp (utility functions)
key_algorithms_documented: MILP branch-and-cut on ALPS parallel tree search
Strong branching: solve child LPs, measure Δobj⁺/Δobj⁻
Pseudo-cost formula: ψ⁺ = Δobj⁺/(1-f), ψ⁻ = Δobj⁻/f
Branching score: weight·min(Δ⁺,Δ⁻) + (1-weight)·max(Δ⁺,Δ⁻)
Reliability branching: strong until pseudo-costs reliable
LP warm start with CoinWarmStartBasis serialization
Hash-based cut deduplication with parallelism detection
Node processing loop: LP→cuts→heuristics→branch
CGL integration: Gomory, Clique, MIR, Probing, etc.
Bilevel branching for two-level optimization problems

Dip.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 24 core headers annotated. Decomposition for Integer Programming - Dantzig-Wolfe column generation with ALPS integration.
key_subsystems_documented: Core: Decomp.h (enums, constants, solver interfaces), DecompApp.h (user application)
Algorithms: DecompAlgo (base), DecompAlgoPC (Price-and-Cut), DecompAlgoC (Cutting Plane), DecompAlgoRC (Relax-and-Cut)
Variables/Cuts: DecompVar (lambda columns), DecompCut (x-space cuts), DecompVarPool, DecompCutPool
Model: DecompModel, DecompConstraintSet (A, b, l, u), DecompSubModel (with solver)
ALPS Integration: AlpsDecompModel, AlpsDecompTreeNode, AlpsDecompNodeDesc, AlpsDecompSolution
Support: DecompParam (100+ params), DecompStats, DecompSolverResult, DecompMemPool
key_algorithms_documented: Dantzig-Wolfe decomposition: A = [A''; A'], pricing subproblems on A'
Column generation: rc(s) = c's - u'(A''s) - alpha_block
Dual stabilization: Wentges smoothing for oscillation control
Price-and-Cut phases: PRICE1 (feasibility), PRICE2 (optimizing), CUT
Cutting plane method: LP relaxation + CGL cuts
Relax-and-Cut: Lagrangian relaxation with subgradient optimization
Cut reformulation: x-space cuts transformed to lambda-space
Column/cut effectiveness tracking for pool management

DisCO.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 24 headers annotated. Discrete Conic Optimization - MISOCP solver with OA or direct conic solving.
key_subsystems_documented: Core: Dco.h (enums: constraint/cone types, cut/branch strategies), DcoModel (MISOCP model with two modes)
Tree Node: DcoTreeNode (processing flow: bound→cuts→branch), DcoNodeDesc, DcoSubTree
Constraints: DcoConstraint (base), DcoLinearConstraint (sparse row), DcoConicConstraint (Lorentz cone with OA supports)
Variables: DcoVariable (integrality, infeasibility calculation)
Branching: DcoBranchObject, DcoBranchStrategyMaxInf/Pseudo/Strong/Rel
Cut Generation: DcoConGenerator (base), DcoLinearConGenerator (CGL), DcoConicConGenerator (OA)
Heuristics: DcoHeuristic (base), DcoHeurRounding (Achterberg's simple rounding)
I/O: DcoCbfIO (Conic Benchmark Format reader/writer)
Support: DcoParams, DcoSolution, DcoMessage, DcoPresolve, DcoConfig
key_algorithms_documented: MISOCP: Mixed-Integer Second-Order Cone Programming
Two solving modes: Direct conic (OsiConicSolverInterface) or OA (linear cuts)
Lorentz cone: ||x_{1..n-1}|| <= x_n
Rotated Lorentz cone: 2*x_1*x_2 >= ||x_{3..n}||^2
Outer Approximation: linear supporting hyperplanes for conic constraints
Pseudocost branching: score = (1-u)*min + u*max, u=1/6 (Achterberg)
Strong branching: solve child LPs, product scoring
Maximum infeasibility branching: most fractional variable
CGL cut integration for MILP cuts
Conic OA cut types: IPM, OA, MIR, GD1

Smi.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 9 headers annotated. Stochastic Mathematical programming Interface - scenario-based stochastic LP/QP with SMPS support.
key_subsystems_documented: Core: SmiScnModel (scenario model with DE generation), SmiScnNode (tree nodes)

Distributions: SmiDiscreteDistribution, SmiDiscreteRV, SmiDiscreteEvent
Rules: SmiCoreCombineRule (Replace/Add singletons)
Containers: SmiLinearData (LP data bundle), SmiQuadraticData (QP objective)
Support: SmiMessage (logging)
key_algorithms_documented: Deterministic Equivalent (DE) formulation from scenario tree
SMPS format: 3-file standard (core.mps + time + stoch)
Scenario tree: root-to-leaf paths = scenarios
Core+Stoch combination rules: Replace (default) or Add
Stage-based variable/constraint partitioning
Wait-and-See (WS), Expected Value (EV), EEV solutions
Discrete distribution → scenario tree expansion

oBB.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! 5 headers annotated. oBB is primarily Python, with bundled NLopt C/C++ subset for SLSQP local optimization.

SLSQP: slsqp/slsqp.h (Sequential Least Squares Programming - Kraft 1988)
key_algorithms_documented: SLSQP - Sequential Least Squares Programming (local, gradient-based)
QP subproblem: min (1/2)d'Bd + g'd s.t. linearized constraints
BFGS Hessian approximation updates
Line search along descent direction
Stopping criteria: stopval, ftol_rel/abs, xtol_rel/abs, maxeval, maxtime

key_concepts_documented: Extended Supporting Hyperplane (ESH) algorithm for convex MINLP
Dual problem via MIP linearization (CPLEX/Gurobi/CBC/HiGHS)
Primal bounds via fixed-integer NLP subproblems (Ipopt)
Hyperplane generation at boundary and interior points
Integer cuts (no-goods) for MINLP refinement
OSoL/OSrL XML formats for options and results
Term hierarchy: LinearTerm, QuadraticTerm, MonomialTerm, SignomialTerm
Constraint hierarchy with gradient/Hessian computation
Task-based modular algorithm composition
Rootsearch for constraint boundary finding

OS.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! All 66 headers already have comprehensive Doxygen @file/@class/@brief documentation. Optimization Services XML-based web services standard.

Cmpl.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! All 100 headers annotated with @file/@brief/@see tags. Mathematical programming language and interpreter.

Expression parsing and code generation

Creme.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! All 12 headers annotated. Randomized LP solver using RTR algorithm.
key_subsystems_documented: Core data: sparse.h (sparseLP structure - CSR format)
Algorithms: rtr.h (randomized rounding), locsrch.h (local search), linopt.h (one-opt)
Utilities: lpio.h (file I/O), init.h (initialization), move.h (variable updates)
Support: isfeas.h (feasibility check), chooseblock.h (constraint selection), misc.h (helpers)
Interface: cmdline.h (argument parsing)

GAMSlinks.notes: Pass 1 COMPLETE! All 14 headers annotated. GAMS interfaces to COIN-OR solvers.
key_subsystems_documented: Solver interfaces: GamsCbc.hpp (MIP), GamsIpopt.hpp (NLP), GamsBonmin.hpp (MINLP), GamsCouenne.hpp (global MINLP), GamsOsi.hpp (LP), GamsScip.hpp (MINLP), GamsSoPlex.hpp (LP)
NLP support: GamsNLP.hpp (TNLP for Ipopt), GamsMINLP.hpp (TMINLP for Bonmin/Couenne)
Utilities: GamsOsiHelper.hpp (OSI data transfer), GamsMessageHandler.hpp (logging), GamsJournal.hpp (Ipopt output)
Callbacks: GamsCbcHeurSolveTrace.hpp (solve trace)
